title: Police seek cars and suspects in early morning shootout
content: Several bullet casings were all Pembroke Pines Police found at the scene of a reported shootout between two cars that sped away eastbound on Pines Boulevard, early Saturday.    An anonymous tipster reported hearing a volley of gunfire shortly before 4 a.m. in the 10000 block of Pines Boulevard a few blocks west of the police department, officials said.    Detectives said they are searching for the make and model of each vehicle and the people who were in them during the shootings.    Investigators are asking anyone with information about the shootings to contact Pembroke Pines Police at 954-431-2200, or by email at tips@ppines.com, or call Broward Crime Stoppers at 954-493-8477 or go online to browardcrimestoppers.org .    wkroustan@sunsentinel.com or 954-356-4303 or Twitter @WayneRoustan    Gun fires during fistfight in Pembroke Lakes Mall    Man charged with phoning bomb threat to Pembroke Pines mosque    Shooting victim dies after being left at hospital, cops say
